intro: Oxydectes bonplandiana, commonly known as the Bonplandian star-of-Bahamas, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
